triplets: Protective structure attached to the exterior of a building, designed to provide shade and shelter
Providing shade from sunlight, shelter from rain, reducing heat inside buildings, and enhancing aesthetic appeal
Weather-resistant fabric (such as acrylic or polyester), aluminum or steel frames, plastic or metal fittings, sometimes wood for decorative awnings
Fabric or canvas cover that blocks sunlight and rain
Frame or support structure made of aluminum, steel, or wood
Mounting hardware including brackets, screws, and joints
Varies widely; can be solid colors, striped patterns, or custom designs depending on manufacturer and user preference
Building exterior, terraces, windows, patios, storefronts, or outdoor seating areas
Various manufacturers specializing in outdoor structures, home improvement, and architectural accessories
Varies depending on size, materials, and frame design
Typically extends 2–3 meters from the building surface, depending on design and purpose
Approximately 5–15 years depending on materials, maintenance, weather exposure, and quality of installation
